comment: If you struggle with accounting take his course. He offers a lot of extra credit, exams are in person which is unlike other accounting courses that make you use MonitorEDU (which is very uncomfortable). Overall great professor will work with you, take him you won't regret it.
Prolly one of the best accounting professors at KSU

Great professor. Be prepared to read the book though. Mcgraw assignment for every unit but gives you enough time. Has extra credit opportunities on random days. If you're not sure about accounting, take him and I'm sure you'll pass.

Hard class obviously especially second half of the semester. The teacher is good and teaches effectively. To do well, go to the SI sessions once a week and do the mcgraw hill homework. He gives a few extra credit oppurtunities and is very lenient with grading.

Very knowledgeable about what he's teaching. Love him. You can tell he wants his students to succeed. Uses homework grades as a way to boost your grade if you don't do well on tests. Tests are easy if you study. Provides study guides exactly like the test. Would take him again.

ONLINE: 2 hw assignments and a quiz on Connect due a week. 2 tests, & a final, curved. Tests in the same format as comp. review. I found his lectures difficult to understand, but taking notes with the hw videos on connect and getting tutoring earned me an A. 
Only negative I will say is that due dates on connect are not updated until the week of.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Professor Landis was the best! Class is not mandatory, but he does give extra credit in class only. Assignments due every week but they are not difficult. 2 exams and 1 final, all of them are curved by a percentage, he monitors the room heavily so make sure to study. He also curves final grades if you are on the borderline. Take him!

Definitely take a class with this professor! I did it online and there are multiple attempts on homework, classwork, and quizzes. The exams are almost identical to the comprehensive review, and he curved each exam (one by 8 points). There's one easy Excel project that I finished in 1 night. You'll definitely get an A with little effort.

His class is very standard for ACCT 2101. His lectures are easy to follow and he breaks everything down and makes it easier to understand. Lots of practice problems and examples so you'll know what the tests are like. The Excel project is the same no matter what teacher you have, it's super easy just takes a couple of hours, nothing to worry about.

Professor Landis is a great teacher! As long as you are active in the class, asking questions, and attending the lectures, he will make sure you do well in his class. You have to make sure you are doing your part and he will work with you! Landis is a good man, he has my utmost respect.
Professor Landis is easy to follow along with in lectures, he breaks down accounting principles logically and is very helpful and fair when it comes to course work and grading.

He has a really good vibe and real positive energy. Coming from Benedikt Quosigk's class to Professor Landis was interesting because Professor Landis kept saying "accounting is easy," while Quosigk kept emphasizing it's hard and tough.
Landis drops a lot of gems on stocks and business throughout his lesson which I really like.
Very pleasant person.
Take this class! I greatly enjoyed his 2101 class, he's a great professor. He provides a clear path to an A.

Accounting is a hard class in general but he offers extra credit and grades on an extreme curve. As long as you're trying you'll definitely pass, tests are hard but all the homework and test review through McGraw Hill covers most of it so its not that big of a deal. Nice guy and compared to some others ive heard of is one of the better ones at KSU

Maybe I'm bad at acct, but this class was rough. 2 tests and a final make up almost 60% of your grade and are difficult; most of my class struggled w them. CW, HW, and quizzes are through MHConnect, with (I would say) more work than a standard Connect-based class. Prepare yourself for the Excel project, it's definitely the worst part of the class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: 2 tests and a final are the bulk of ur grade. He curves tests and finals a lot which is helpful towards ur gpa but annoying because it's not like your grade reflects that you know it. I'll prob finish with a B but haven't gotten higher than a 70 on any test. Pretty hard class and has tons hw for each unit. Try to get a teacher with a better rating
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: This professor is very nice, The issue is that he is just not a good teacher. His lectures are so boring and he gives you endless homework assignments. The VERY FIRST DAY back from break we had 6 homework assignments and two quizzes due THAT NIGHT with no warning at all. It is very difficult to pass his tests but he will curve them heavily.

Even the way Landis says, "Alright, let's go ahead and get started." will already tell you that you're in for something boring. This man is impossible to pay attention to during lecture with his VERY monotone voice & AWFUL handwriting. Majority of students are zoned out during his lectures. Really sucks because the course material is difficult.

Tests were difficult to me because he doesnt give out practice exams. homework and quizzes for every chapter. extra credit for each unit. Reviewed all quizzes and notes and barely passed the tests. Curved the tests and maybe your grade. Everything else is super easy so do all the assignments
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: He's a cool guy. I'm a not-so-great student and I did fine. The tests are what matter, but all of your other grades make up for it. I didn't pass one test and made a B. He curves every test, midterm and final. And on top of that adds extra credit for showing up randomly and curves final grades at end. Very grading lenient professor. Would take ag.

Super difficult class. I do not recommend because of many reasons. His handwriting is not the neatest, tests are a majority of your grade so if you arent good at accounting do not take him. I need a more hands on learning experience and more assignments that make me think out of the box. Not just a few tests, homework, packback, excel assignment.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Decent choice for accounting but very hard for an intro level class. Lectures are impossible to stay paying attention through the whole thing and you can easily notice that if you look around the classroom at other students. I believe he had the SI in the class do all of the grading for him too. Assignments aren't too hard but tests can be hard.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Landis is great. Although he is kind of messy/unorganized. The best way to get through this class is to pull up the textbook while he is working on the problems in class. There is a lot of homework. He does curve the tests pretty heavy which helps a lot. He also really wants everyone to be successful. Class is hard but professor is nice.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Very lenient professor who wants you to do well in the class. It is accounting however so you will to put some work in to understand the material. Online hw but it's on a point system so you can pick and choose which assignments to do. Going to class really helps but is not mandatory. Exams are in person and always curved.

He is really slow on email so if you have questions, be sure to ask them in class. He also gives a late notice on schedule changes but aside from that, he is a really nice and funny guy. Lectures were good, and he is willing repeat things if you ask. He also extends test dates and hw dates if need be. He gives extra credit and is an easy grader.

This is prob the best professor to take acct with, however, be prepared for it. The lectures are very long and boring and he has awful handwriting. The homework is not too difficult but takes time. Really study for the tests though, you're gonna need to. There are also writing assignments that aren't bad and Packback discussions which kind of suck.

Go to class and do everything you can to study the quizzes and the Mod Ec's. Very nice guy and a great Professor. But everything he covers only helps you a little compared to the problems. Most studying should be on your own you will have to remember a lot of material.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Accounting is generally just hard but Professor Landis makes it feel easier. He is an extremely comforting professor that just wants to see his students succeed in the course. His lectures are really in-depth and very useful to pay attention to. He also curves a lot and has a lot of extra credit opportunities. Take him!!!

His lectures are long but important. He gives some extra credit for showing up to class on random days, so technically attendance is not mandatory. Assigns more hw than counted to help you, we used MH connect for textbook and tests. He doesn't write the tests or quizzes the department does. 2 tests 2 quizzes, packback, excel project, essay, final.

Listen, he's not the worst, but don't expect him to be fantastic either. His lectures drone on and his work is not difficult. Practice questions are minimal help, but the book is what made me get an A. I could have never went to class and got the same grade because I had to study so much outside of class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Test heavy

comment: Class consists of 2 exams, a final, and homework that makes up a majority of your grade. He has class notes and powerpoints that are very helpful to refresh your mind before the test. He is a great communicator, a great listener, and a fair professor.

Literally the easiest class ever, but was taken during COVID. He is so flexible with grades, even changed the test date for me bc I couldnt make it to a test. Love him!! I wish I could take him for every class
Amazing professor. Makes accounting easy. Will give random extra credit.

I took it in Spring 2020. The lectures were sometimes very long and boring, but informational nonetheless. He really does prepare you for the tests, but you still have to do a bit of studying for them. The tests are application-based, where you are given scenarios instead of straight out vocabulary. Solid choice.

Lots of assignments on connect, which is the online textbook. Had to take the online class because of corona. He posted his lectures twice a week, basically a recording of him going over the class notes. You'll need to read the textbook and study hard over his notes, the material is difficult. He does curve grades, but it did not help me much.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: A nice guy and a pretty good class but he's got a very monotone voice and it's hard to pay attention the entire class. Quite a bit of homework but if you get a chegg membership 100% of the homework answers are on there. He offers quite a bit of extra credit which is really helpful. Not the best class i've taken but definitely not the worst.

Professor Landis is a solid choice for Blaw. Attendance isn't mandatory, but it helps to go for a clear understanding and extra credit is only given in class. He answers every question asked with detail and gives several examples. Test are application-based, but not that bad if you study and go to class. No quizzes, just learnsmart homework.

Professor Landis is an amazing teacher. During each class he would go over each chapter during his lecture with notes he made for that chapter and then post them online. His tests are very straight forward and if you go to the class before the test day he gives a study guide but only to those who show up. BEST EVER for a harder class!!!!
He is a very boring professor. His exams are nothing like his notes. You are really teaching yourself in this course
Amazing professor, I took him for acct 2100 and wanted to take him for 2200 too but he doesn't teach it this semester. I would take him again for every accounting class!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Landis is a great professor. He reads from power points in Business Law class and answers questions clearly. Highly recommend finishing his homework (LearnSmart) in advance, it's simple. His exams are mental concepts and scenarios, don't expect definitions. So be prepared, I warned you!!

2 tests and cumulative final. Make sure to get the easy points from homework and quizzes because it'll help you at the end of the semester. Offers extra credit in class but doesn't tell what day to be fair to students who showed up to class. Will explain again if students ask. Doesn't provide a study guide but does do in class review before tests.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Great guy, very relatable and funny. The class as a whole is difficult but he does a good job of woking with you and amending the schedule/syllabus if he sees the class is struggling. Definitely would recommend showing up for class as he gives in class extra credit and extra helpful notes. My study group and I all received A's in the class.
Solid professor that breaks down the content well. Pay attention during lectures and you'll be fine.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: He is an absolute must! Easy grader, easy credit, and flexible. Actually enjoyed his class. He will scale all grades up if you listen to him at the beginning of the semester.

TAKE PROF LANDIS! Great professor, answers a lot of questions we had from lecture notes since he isnt solely an accounting professor. Lots of extra credit online as well as in class, SO GO TO CLASS! Hes also hilarious and very caring about everyones grade, and making sure everyone can succeed. Very fast responses via email as well. Take him!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Landis is a nice guy who does his best. When I took this course, I struggled with a full-time job and a heavy school load, so I did not do well in the class at all, but then again, I rarely went. I feel like the use of connect was slightly unclear. Tests are hard. Overall, a nice guy. Go to class
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Prof Landis will admit to you that he isn't an expert in accounting, but he sure does his best to teach well. I didn't find 2100 to be very difficult taking him, and the online homework and online quizzes count for so much of your grade. He massively curves the test, and he is a good guy. Gonna try to take him for 2200 too.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: This guy convinced me to become an accounting major. Hes awesome take him for any class you can get him in
Professor Landis encouraged me to change my major to accounting. He is a fantastic teacher and Ive taken him for both 2100 and 2200. I cant recommend him enough.

overall the material was hard but he did his best to teach it. make sure to do you connect homework and you will pass. I failed 2/3 test and still got a c in the class. he does give extra credit as well. overall a good teacher

As someone who knows nothing about accounting, Professor Landis made it easy to understand. He's a solid guy and tries to relate our course material to the real world to make it easier for students. Lots of homework- however if you go to class he will give the answers and explain how to do the problems. Definitely take him!

If you are not really good at accounting or using numbers, do not take him. He moves really fast and scribbles all over the whiteboard. He is really hard to follow. His voice makes you not want to go to class and he is a very boring professor. If you miss one day, you will miss a lot. His tests are all in class and they are hard.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: I can't believe these ratings. I hated accounting 2100 and got a C with a "good" professor, however with Landis I got an A. I would definitely recommend him. He's VERY helpful, straightforward, and fair. Nice guy. I would 100% take him again.
One of the worst professors Ive have this far at KSU. I would highly recommend taking a different professor. Just reads from the powerpoints created from the text book.
Professor Landis is helpful with a difficult subject matter. Cost Acct is somewhat boring but he makes the subject clear.

Class consists of Prof. Landis reading straight from powerpoints and working out example problems in a fairly unclear manner, while occasionally being corrected by students. He's unenthusiastic and doesn't particularly seem like he wants to be there. The only time you can ask him questions is before/after class or by appointment. Not an easy class.
He teaches straight from the power points. He is very monotone and boring. He is not willing to make himself available to help you at all.

Professor Landis literally teaches directly from his publisher-issued PowerPoints, not to say class attendance isn't useful. Eager to help and smart, you can tell he knows what he's talking about, however, can't clarify the material very well. If you're someone who is not very good at self-teaching themselves, then he isn't the professor for you.
Subject matter is tough but the professor is nice and helpful.
He does not teach. He reads PPT that are online. If you ask him to help with a problem he cannot work it out. If you have to take this class do yourself a favor and take a better proffesor.

Very nice guy.  Tough subject to soak in your brain.  He does his best to help you and is a fair professor.  I recommend to go to class every day.  Missing one day will screw you over and will have a tough time catching up.  This class is definitely not easy.
